Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
goof \goof\ n. a stupid fool. [Colloq.]
Syn: fathead, jackass, goose, cuckoo, zany. [WordNet 1.5]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
goof \goof\ v. i. to commit a faux pas or fault.
Syn: sin, commit an offence, blunder, boob. [WordNet 1.5]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Gove \Gove\ (g[=o]v), n. [Also {goaf}, {goof}, {goff}.] A mow; a rick for hay. [Obs.] --Tusser. [1913 Webster]

goof n : a man who is a stupid incompetent fool [syn: {fathead}, {goofball}, {bozo}, {jackass}, {goose}, {cuckoo}, {twat}, {zany}] v : commit a faux pas or a fault or make a serious mistake; "I blundered during the job interview" [syn: {sin}, {blunder}, {boob}]
